types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: User
types.description:
# Uplay user node.

This is not a profile and profile data can be queried through the different fields of a User node.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The `id` only serves as a cache key. Always add it to your query, but
avoid using it anywhere else. Use the `userId` to identify a User node.

fields.name: badges
fields.description: List of badges the user obtained

fields.name: name
fields.description: Username of this user. Note that it's not the person's fullname.

fields.name: avatarUrl
fields.description:
The user's current avatar URL.

Uses the Ubisoft Web Services' [Avatar service](http://webservices-apis-docs.ubisoft.org/avatars-public/prod/).

fields.name: onlineReputation
fields.description:
The user's current global reputation level.

Uses the Ubisoft Connect Service' [ORS service](https://apidoc-ubiconnect.horizon.ubisoft.org/#get-/v1/profiles/-profileId-/global/ubiconnect/ors/api/games).

fields.name: isOnBoardingCompleted
fields.description: If true it means the user has completed the Online Reputation System Onboarding

fields.name: awarenessProgramStatus
fields.description: If true it means the user has completed the Online Reputation System Onboarding

fields.name: isAvatarBanned
fields.description: If true, the avatar image URL will be replaced by a default image.

fields.name: canUploadAvatar
fields.description:
A profile can be banned from uploading avatars. In this case, the user can
only choose from the gallery.

fields.name: isViewer
fields.description: True if this user node is the logged in user.

fields.name: hasMobileApp
fields.description: True if the user's session on either iOS or Android mobile app.

fields.name: game
fields.description:
Useful to get meta data of this user for a specific game.

Provide either a `spaceId` or a `slug`. In a last resort effort, the
slug will be used as a spaceId if nothing else worked.

fields.name: games
fields.description: All the games this user owns. To be considered own, a game must have had at least one session.

fields.name: expirationForecasts
fields.description: User's expiring units.

fields.name: lastPlayedGame
fields.description: First game in the `games` list.

fields.name: level
fields.description: Uplay profile level gained from all earned xp.

fields.name: levelProgression
fields.description: Decimal fraction proportion of the currently accumulated xp towards the next level. E.g. 0.75 would mean 75%.

fields.name: minor
fields.description:
True if the user account is a minor. Currently only usable with viewer.
According to Ubiservices, an account is considered as a minor account only if the date of birth is
under the age of legal consent per country and above 13 years old.
Legal consent per country defined here: https://confluence.ubisoft.com/x/BrVvIQ

fields.name: unitsBalance
fields.description:
Total count of units owned by a user. This number will change after any transaction
(redeeming a reward, banking a challenge, unit expiration, etc.)

fields.name: creationDate
fields.description: Ubisoft user account creation date. Currently only usable with viewer

fields.name: creationYearsCount
fields.description: Standardized years count based on the creation date. Currently only usable with viewer

fields.name: xp
fields.description: Total number of experience points a user has gained until now.

fields.name: nextLevelXp
fields.description: Cumulative number of experience points necessary to reach the next level.

fields.name: nextLevelRewards
fields.description: List of level-specific rewards that will be rewarded upon reaching the next level. A level reward is an amount of items awarded upon leveling up. Currently supports only units

fields.name: feed
fields.description:
The list of feed items to show to the user.
The limit parameter will control the maximum number of feeditems returned.
Currently any query with a limit > 20 will still get a max of 20 feed items, due to performance constraints.

fields.name: feedItem
fields.description: A single feed item from the user's feed

fields.name: notifications
fields.description: The list of notification items to show to the user.

fields.name: channels
fields.description: The list of chat channels for Ubisoft Connect. Currently works with only the viewer.

fields.name: completedClassicChallenges
fields.description: Number of classic challenges (achievements-like) completed across all owned games.

fields.name: reward
fields.description: Consult a reward in the context of a user.

fields.name: friends
fields.description:
List of friends for the current user's `userId`.

Can be filtered by `requestStatus` and `spaceId`.
Can only be used if current user is the viewer.

args.name: after
args.description: UserId of the friend after which the next chunk of friends starts.

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: Provides data based on the current connected user. Will be null if current user is the viewer.

fields.name: blockedUsers
fields.description:
Can only be used if current user is the viewer.
The `totalCount` can't be used as it can't be known without fetching the
entire list, page per page.

fields.name: platforms
fields.description: Unique platforms across all owned games. (e.g. PC, XONE, PS4, Stadia, etc.)

fields.name: ownedPlatforms
fields.description: Unique platforms across all owned games. (e.g. PC, XONE, PS4, Stadia, etc.)

fields.name: totalPlatformsCount
fields.description: It's just a convenient `platforms.length`, it reduces the response payload.

fields.name: networks
fields.description: Networks on which this user has profiles. E.g. PSN, XBL, etc.

fields.name: dailyLogin
fields.description: Get a specific daily login (Smart Intel feature) received after connecting to games

fields.name: dailyLogins
fields.description: Last daily logins (Smart Intel feature) received after connecting to games

fields.name: ownerships
fields.description: Ownerships of the user

fields.name: parties
fields.description: Game parties in the given spaceId where the requester is a member or owner.

args.name: limit
args.description: Defaults to service default. Maximum limit size is 50.

fields.name: partyInvitations
fields.description: Party invitations in the given spaceId where the requester is invitee.

args.name: limit
args.description: Defaults to service default. Maximum limit size is 50.

fields.name: standardPreferences
fields.description: Standard preferences (crossPlayEnabled) of the viewer for a game.

fields.name: joinableParties
fields.description: Joinable parties for the viewer in a given space based on sent in profileIds.

types.name: UserUsersConnection
types.description: Connection between a user and multiple other users

fields.name: userId
fields.description: The related user's `userId`

fields.name: userIds
fields.description: List of `userId`s in relation to the current user

fields.name: fromUserId
fields.description: `userId` of the current user

fields.name: toUserId
fields.description: `userId` in relation to the current user

types.name: UserPartiesConnection
types.description: Connection between a user and game parties where the user is a member or owner.

fields.name: userId
fields.description: The related user's `userId`

types.name: UserPartyInvitationsConnection
types.description: Connection between a user and game party invitations where the user is invitee.

fields.name: userId
fields.description: The related user's `userId`

types.name: UserJoinablePartiesConnection
types.description: Connection between a user and game joinable parties where the user is the requester.

fields.name: userId
fields.description: The related user's `userId`

types.name: UserUserMeta
types.description: Metadata on the relationship between a user and a game.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The `id` only serves as a cache key. Always add it to your query, but
avoid using it anywhere else. Use `fromUserId` or `toUserId` to identify the users
related to these metadata.

fields.name: fromUserId
fields.description: `userId` of the current user

fields.name: toUserId
fields.description: `userId` in relation to the current user

fields.name: isFriend
fields.description: Friendship status related to if a the user as a `requestStatus` value of `FRIENDS` or not

fields.name: isBlocked
fields.description:
Target user was blocked by current user.

**IMPORTANT:** only works with the currently logged in user. The query will fail if
used with two unrelated users.

**NOTE:** Only checks for the Player Progression spaceId, which means it won't
return true if a user was blocked for a specific game, it'll only work for
Ubisoft Connect Apps like the chat, etc.

fields.name: requestStatus
fields.description: Status of the friendship request

fields.name: gamesInCommonCount
fields.description: **DEPRECATED** Games in common between two users.

fields.name: gamesInCommon
fields.description: Games that both users have in common.

fields.name: canReportAvatar
fields.description: Reportability of a user's custom avatar

fields.name: nickname
fields.description:
The nickname of the friend.
By default it is empty and support UTF8 unicode, no forbidden chars with max lentgh of 256 chars.

fields.name: isFavorite
fields.description: Define if the current friend is a favorite one, false by default.

types.name: UserRecentlyMetEventsConnection
types.description: Connection between a user and recently met events

fields.name: fromUserId
fields.description: The related user's `userId`

types.name: DailyLoginsConnection
types.description: Connection between a user and daily logins

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The `id` only serves as a cache key. Always add it to your query, but
avoid using it anywhere else. Use the `spaceId` to identify a Game node.

fields.name: spaceId
fields.description: Identify a Game node, used in most Ubisoft services.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of a game, its title.

fields.name: backgroundUrl
fields.description: Often used as a background banner.

fields.name: lowBoxArtUrl
fields.description: Used to be known as the `coverUrl`.

fields.name: isPeriodicChallengeSupported
fields.deprecationReason: Not supported anymore. Will always return true.

fields.name: isRecentlyMetSupported
fields.description: True if the game supports the recently met feature. This depends on the app id.

fields.name: platformName
fields.description: Name of the platform (console, PC, stadia, etc.) of this specific game node.

fields.name: platform
fields.description:
Default platform for a game, regardless of any user context. Be aware that
it might return a platform that is different from the spaceId used to
identify the game if the space is configured to have multiple platforms.

To get the platform a user played on or owns, use either `lastPlayedOn`
or `ownedCrossplayPlatforms` from the `UserGameMeta` node.

fields.name: availablePlatforms
fields.description: Platforms on which the game is available.

fields.name: crossplayPlatforms
fields.description:
If the game has crossplay available, these are the platforms on which it's
available.

fields.name: availablePlatformGroups
fields.description:
Some crossplay session will only be available inbetween sub-groups of
platforms, instead of being available across the whole set.

fields.name: isCrossplaySupported
fields.description: Game progession is available across more than one platform.

fields.name: releaseDate
fields.description: Release date timestamp or null if unavailable.

fields.name: releaseStatus
fields.description:
If the game isn't released yet, this will be the localized message indicating when it'll be released.

This is `null` if the game was released.

fields.name: periodicChallenge
fields.description: Get a specific time limited challenge from this game node.

fields.name: periodicChallenges
fields.description: Get all the time limited challenges from this game node.

fields.name: periodicChallengePools
fields.description: Old aggregation pool when time limited challenges were only ever changed weekly.

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: Meta data on the logged in user for this game.

fields.name: periodicChallengePrizes
fields.description: All the currencies and items rewarded for weekly challenges currently.

fields.name: classicChallenges
fields.description: The game's classic challenges.

fields.name: clubUrl
fields.description: URL to the club's Website URL, which will be/is the Ubisoft Connect website as well.
fields.deprecationReason: At Ubisoft Connect full launch, the club will be rebranded and the URL will change as well.

fields.name: slug
fields.description:
For legacy reasons, the website, which used to be managed through some
internal CMS, uses unique slugs to identify a game in the URL.

This data is pulled from a custom mapping config (slug-spaceId) which is
manually updated.

It defaults to the game's spaceId if the slug isn't found.

fields.name: statistics
fields.description: Get all node statistics. By default the viewer userId is used, but a specific userId can be defined

fields.name: communityCreationAvailableFilters
fields.description: Get available filter types for a community creation type

fields.name: communityCreationAvailableOrderings
fields.description: Get available order types for a community creation type

fields.name: communityCreations
fields.description: Get creations (photo/map/video/story) that has been shared by a player for this game

fields.name: communityCreation
fields.description: Get a creation (photo/map/video/story) that has been shared by a player for this game

fields.name: viewerFriends
fields.description: List of friends playing the current game based on the viewer's `userId`

fields.name: secondaryStoreOffer
fields.description: Query a specific secondary store offer for a game

fields.name: secondaryStoreOffers
fields.description: Query the game's secondary store offers

fields.name: secondaryStoreTradesConfig
fields.description: Query the game's secondary store trades config

inputFields.name: platforms
inputFields.description:
Filter the games by platform.

Not implemented yet.

inputFields.name: isReleased
inputFields.description: If the game is coming soon, etc.

inputFields.name: isInCommon
inputFields.description: If the game is in common between viewer and user

fields.name: spaceId
fields.description: This is a relationship data, don't use it

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: The total number of all the different prizes. Not the cumulated values.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: Count all the rewards, the limit filter is excluded from the count

fields.name: spaceId
fields.deprecationReason: Use the parent node's `spaceId` or the rewards themselves.

types.name: UserGameMeta
types.description:
Metadata on the relationship between a user and a game.

Here lies the game progression data.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The `id` only serves as a cache key. Always add it to your query, but
avoid using it anywhere else. Use either the `userId` to identify the user
related to these metadata or the `spaceId` to identify a Game node.

fields.name: onlineReputation
fields.description:
Query the game reputation level.

Uses the Ubisoft Connect Service' [ORS service](https://apidoc-ubiconnect.horizon.ubisoft.org/#get-/v1/profiles/-profileId-/global/ubiconnect/ors/api/games).

fields.name: communityCreations
fields.description: Query the game's community creations in the context of a user.

fields.name: rewards
fields.description: Query the game's rewards in the context of a user.

fields.name: parties
fields.description: Game parties the where the user is a member or owner.

args.name: limit
args.description: Defaults to service default. Maximum limit size is 50.

fields.name: partyInvitations
fields.description: Party invitations where the user is invitee.

args.name: limit
args.description: Defaults to service default. Maximum limit size is 50.

fields.name: joinableParties
fields.description: Joinable parties where the user is the requester. Will accept any user's profileId.

fields.name: periodicChallenges
fields.description: Query the game's periodic challenges in the context of a user.

fields.name: periodicChallengePrizes
fields.description: All the currencies and items rewarded for weekly challenges currently.

fields.name: periodicChallengeThresholds
fields.description: All the currencies and items rewarded for weekly challenges currently.

fields.name: classicChallenges
fields.description: Query the game's classic challenges in the context of a user.

fields.name: lastPlayedDate
fields.description:
Date string of the last session for this game by the user.

_*Warning:* Only works with the authenticated user. For privacy and security
purposes, any other user's last played date is null._

fields.name: lastPlayedOn
fields.description: Platform of the last session for this game by the user.

fields.name: lastPlayedPlatform
fields.description: Last played platform for this game by the user.

fields.name: playTime
fields.description: Time in seconds that the player has spent playing this game.

fields.name: formattedPlayTime
fields.description: Play time formatted into text.

fields.name: ownedCrossplayPlatforms
fields.description:
Other platforms a user owns the game on, on which they could continue their
progression.

fields.name: ownedPlatformGroups
fields.description: The user owns the game on at least one platform of each of these groups.

fields.name: isOwned
fields.description: True if the user has made at least one session.

fields.name: hasPlaySession
fields.description: True if the user has a play session.

fields.name: friends
fields.description: List of friends playing the current game based on the viewer's `userId`

args.name: after
args.description: UserId of the friend after which the next chunk of friends starts.

fields.name: secondaryStoreItems
fields.description: Query the game's secondary store items in the context of a user.

fields.name: standardPreferences
fields.description: User's standard preferences for the selected game.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: Count of the filtered, unique, rewards, ignoring the `limit` parameter.

fields.name: redeemedCount
fields.description: The number of unique rewards that have been completely redeemed. Based on `UserRewardMeta.isRedeemed`.

fields.name: purchasesCount
fields.description:
The sum of the rewards purchases count. Based on `UserRewardMeta.redeemedCount`.

Some rewards can be redeemed (purchased for units) multiple times.
Their `count` value is more than one.

fields.name: totalPurchasesCount
fields.description:
Total number of times these rewards can be redeemed, which is different from
the `totalCount` if any rewards can be redeemed more than once.

inputFields.name: isOwned
inputFields.description:
Filters games by wether the user owns it (has a session) or not.

Defaults to `true` to get the user owned games by default.
Pass explicitely `null` to get all games.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: The total number of the different prizes. Not the cumulated values.

fields.name: collectedCount
fields.description: Number of different thresholds that were collected.

fields.name: collectibleCount
fields.description: Number of different thresholds that can be collected.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: The total number of the different prizes. Not the cumulated values.

fields.name: collectedCount
fields.description:
Number of different prizes that were collected.

A prize is counted as collected only if it's no longer possible to collect
anymore from the currently active challenges.

fields.name: totalValuesCount
fields.description: Sum of all the values for the prizes.

fields.name: collectedValuesCount
fields.description: Sum of all the values for the collected prizes.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The `id` only serves as a cache key. Always add it to your query, but
avoid using it anywhere else. Use the `challengeId` to identify a Challenge node.

fields.name: spaceId
fields.description: The related game's `spaceId`.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Challenge's short title.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Describes how to accomplish the challenge.

Sometimes, it may include a placeholder for the value within the text, which needs to be replaced
in the client implementation, however they'd like it to see it rendered.

fields.name: value
fields.description:
The target goal to complete the challenge.

If the challenge has thresholds, this is the target value of the last threshold.

fields.name: isExpired
fields.description: True if the expiration date for this challenge pool is in the past.

fields.name: xpPrize
fields.description: Total experience points that can be earned by completing and claiming this challenge.

fields.name: thresholds
fields.description: Some challenges are split in checkpoint goals with different claimable prize pools.

fields.name: prizes
fields.description: The different game prizes (currencies and items) that are rewarded to a player for each completed threshold that he claims.

inputFields.name: isExpired
inputFields.description: Challenges where the expiration date is in the past.

inputFields.name: viewer
inputFields.description:
**DEPRECATED** Use the `UserGameMeta.periodicChallenges` connection instead.

Filter the challenges acording to their current status.

types.name: PeriodicChallengeViewerFilter
types.description: **DEPRECATED** Use the `UserGameMeta.periodicChallenges` connection instead.

inputFields.name: isCollectible
inputFields.description: Challenges that were completed and collected already.

inputFields.name: isCompleted
inputFields.description: Challenges that were completed but not collected yet.

inputFields.name: isInProgress
inputFields.description: Challenges that are started, which includes partially completed multi-threshold challenges.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: The number of thresholds for this challenge.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: The number of different prizes for this challenge, after filters are applied, if any.

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description:
The number of different prizes for this threshold, after filters are applied, if any.

_Note that it's not the sum of all the prizes value._

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The `id` only serves as a cache key. Always add it to your query, but
avoid using it anywhere else. Use the relevant id to identify a another node.

fields.name: profileId
fields.description: User in the context of this challenge threshold.

fields.name: spaceId
fields.description: Game related to this challenge threshold.

fields.name: challengeId
fields.description: Periodic challenge related to this threshold.

fields.name: thresholdIndex
fields.description: Since the thresholds are not identified with IDs, we're using their index within the challenge thresholds array.

types.name: PeriodicChallengePrize
types.description:
In game items rewarded to a player when a periodic challenge is claimed.

_Note: Used to be 2 different models, `currencyPrizes` and `itemPrizes`.

fields.name: spaceId
fields.description: Game `spaceId` related to this prize.

fields.name: challengeId
fields.description: Periodic challenge `challengeId` related to this prize.

fields.name: prizeId
fields.description: Based on the in-game item ID or the prize type if it lacks an in-game ID.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
**Note on items versus currencies:** if `PeriodicChallengeThresholdPrizeMeta.value` is equal to 1, you could guess
that it's a game item, and that anything above 1 is a currency. But that distinction doesn't exist anywhere other than
in client application designs, so the schema was simplified and this `type` field was provided instead.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Sum of all the prizes values of this type available on this periodic challenge.

fields.name: collectedCount
fields.description:
Sum of all the prizes values of this type collected for this specific challenge.

Usually relevant on challenges that has multiple thresholds, otherwise, it's
the value of this prize on the only challenge threshold.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The `id` only serves as a cache key. Always add it to your query, but
avoid using it anywhere else. Use the `prizeId` to identify a Prize node.

fields.name: spaceId
fields.description: Game `spaceId` related to this prize.

fields.name: challengeId
fields.description: Periodic challenge `challengeId` related to this prize.

fields.name: thresholdIndex
fields.description: Periodic challenge's threshold index related to this prize's meta data.

fields.name: prizeId
fields.description: Based on the in-game item ID or the prize type if it lacks an in-game ID.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Count of this specific prize received when claiming this threshold.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Sum of the prizes' value for all prizes with the same `prizeId` from a game.

fields.name: viewerCollectedCount
fields.description:
**DEPRECATED** Sum of all the prizes value for this game's challenge's prize
which was collected by the logged in user.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Sum of all the prizes values of this type available on this game.

fields.name: collectedCount
fields.description: Sum of all the prizes values of this type collected for this game.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The `id` only serves as a cache key. Always add it to your query, but
avoid using it anywhere else. Use the `prizeId` to identify a Prize node.

fields.name: spaceId
fields.description: Game `spaceId` related to this prize.

fields.name: challengeId
fields.description: Periodic challenge `challengeId` related to this prize.

fields.name: prizeId
fields.description: Based on the in-game item ID or the prize type if it lacks an in-game ID.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Count of this specific prize available on this periodic challenge.

types.name: PeriodicChallengePool
types.description:
This is a legacy type left to be backward-compatible with older client apps.
Please use the new periodic challenges connections and filters to achieve the
pooling and grouping.

fields.name: contribution
fields.description: Player related progression. For a community challenge, this means the user's progressions and not the community's

fields.name: isActivated
fields.description: If a community challenge has been activated. Now, all challenges are being auto-assigned so this will default to `true`

fields.name: isCollectible
fields.description: If a challenge has one or more thresholds that that can be collected

fields.name: isRedeemed
fields.description: If a challenge is fully redeemed. It is the result of a computation of `isCompleted`, `isCollectible` and the player's `contribution` fields

fields.name: isCompleted
fields.description: A challenge is completed when either the community or the player has reached the last threshold value. A challenge can be completed even though it can't be redeemed, in the case the player didn't contribute to a community challenge at all.

fields.name: isInProgress
fields.description: If a challenge is in progress, meaning that the player's progression is over zero but not completed yet

fields.name: hasContributed
fields.description: If a user has contributed to a challenge.

fields.name: progress
fields.description: Overall challenge progression. Its either the player's progression or the community's as a whole

fields.name: progressPercentage
fields.description: Progression percentage of the challenge, based on the last threshold's value and `progress`

fields.name: spaceId
fields.description: This is a relationship data, don't use it

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: Link with the viewer to get the statistic metadata or viewer node

fields.name: user
fields.description: Link with the user to get the statistic metadata or user node

fields.name: players
fields.description: Link with multiple users providing statistic metadata or a user node

fields.name: edges
fields.description: List of edges providing statistic metadata or a user node

fields.name: userId
fields.description: This is a relationship data, don't use it

fields.name: spaceId
fields.description: This is a relationship data, don't use it

fields.name: statId
fields.description: This is a relationship data, don't use it

fields.name: rank
fields.description: Ranking attributed when a stat has a leaderboard. Otherwise will be null. When comparing two direct users, determine rank by comparing `rawScore` and `sortOrder` fields

fields.name: formattedScore
fields.description: Formatted and localized score value

fields.name: score
fields.description: Raw score value. Can be null

fields.name: condition
fields.description: Message when a reward is locked. Is raw HTML

fields.name: instruction
fields.description: Message when a reward has been purchased. Is raw HTML

fields.name: unlockedMessage
fields.description: Message when a reward is unlocked but was not purchased. Is raw HTML

fields.name: conditionSlate
fields.description: Parsed version of the `condition` field

fields.name: instructionSlate
fields.description: Parsed version of the `instruction` field

fields.name: unlockedMessageSlate
fields.description: Parsed version of the `unlockedMessage` field

types.name: ClassicChallenge
types.description:
Achievement-style challenges that never expires.

Though some conditions may sometimes never be met again after, for exemple, the beta period is finished.

fields.name: targetCompletion
fields.description: The target completion value to reach to complete the challenge.

fields.name: currentCompletion
fields.description: Current stat value of the challenge in progress. Is null if challenge is NotStarted

types.name: RecentlyMetEvent
types.description: Recently met event

types.name: DailyLogin
types.description: Daily login

types.name: ExpirationForecast
types.description: Unit expiration forecasts

types.name: PlayerReportCategory
types.description: PlayerReportCategory

fields.name: positive
fields.description: Categories with positive true should be used to report positive player behaviours that are encouraged.

types.name: ReputationDefinition
types.description: Online reputation details, both for global and game specific reputation.

types.name: AwarenessProgram
types.description: Awareness program completion details.

types.name: Party
types.description: Party details.

args.name: limit
args.description: Defaults to service default. Maximum limit size is 50.

args.name: limit
args.description: Defaults to service default. Maximum limit size is 50.

types.name: StandardPreferences
types.description: Standard preferences for a profile.

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: To get any information of the currenctly logged in user, start here!

fields.name: user
fields.description: Query any user's data

fields.name: users
fields.description: Search for users using their username on any supported platforms.

fields.name: firstPartyFriends
fields.description:
Uplay profiles that are friend with the viewer.

_**Important**: Requires a first-party authentication ticket.
The PSN ticket is only valid for 1 hour while the XBL ticket is good for 3._

args.name: firstPartyTicket
args.description: XBL session ticket aren't valid with GraphQL, but still needed to fetch XBL friends.

fields.name: game
fields.description:
Query any game's data.

Provide either a `spaceId` or a `slug`. In a last resort effort, the
slug will be used as a spaceId if nothing else worked.

fields.name: games
fields.description: Query multiple games' data

fields.name: discount
fields.description:
Get the right discount reward for the viewer.

**Warning:** can't be redeemed through GraphQL. The CRM endpoint must be used, which only works on PROD.
`https://{env}crmservicesfacade.ubi.com/customintegrations/CRMCustomIntegrations.svc/rest/v1/profiles/{profileId}/PromotionKeyRewards`

fields.name: featureSwitches
fields.description: Query for the enabled status of a features based on the application id

fields.name: versionStatus
fields.description:
Query for the enabled status of a an app based on the version and its application id.

Warning: Only implemented for mobile right now.

fields.name: legal
fields.description: Query legal content such as terms of use

fields.name: avatarsGalleryGames
fields.description: Games that have avatars from the preselected gallery.

fields.name: playerReportCategory
fields.description: Retrieves categories for this space, includes only enabled categories.

fields.name: collectPeriodicChallenge
fields.description: Collect a specific completed periodic challenge, or just one completed threshold.

fields.name: setOnlineStatus
fields.description:
Only available for the logged in user (viewer).

Setting the status to `ONLINE` is the equivalent of resetting the status.

fields.name: uploadAvatar
fields.description:
## [Uploading an avatar image](https://confluence.ubisoft.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=ubiservdoc&title=Ubisoft+Avatars)

Note that cropping is no longer supported and should be done client side.
**Important**: An image of exactly 500x500 must be sent.

fields.name: updateAvatar
fields.description: Update the avatar from an ID coming from the avatar gallery

fields.name: toggleFeedReaction
fields.description: Toggle the feed item like reaction status

fields.name: dislikeDailyLoginContent
fields.description: Dislike content. contentId can be the id of `ArticleTile`, `YoutubeVideoTile` or `YoutubePlaylistTile`

fields.name: likeDailyLoginContent
fields.description: Like content. contentId can be the id of `ArticleTile`, `YoutubeVideoTile` or `YoutubePlaylistTile`

fields.name: viewDailyLoginContent
fields.description: Inform the service that a content has been viewed. contentId can be the id of `ArticleTile`, `YoutubeVideoTile` or `YoutubePlaylistTile`

fields.name: setOnboardingCompleted
fields.description: Update if the user completed the onboarding

fields.name: sendPartyInvitation
fields.description:
Send party invitation to other player.

Only available for the logged in user (viewer).

Viewer must be an owner or a member of the party.

fields.name: respondToPartyInvitation
fields.description:
Respond to party invitation.

Only available for the logged in user (viewer).

Viewer must have an invitation for party.

fields.name: respondToPartyJoinRequest
fields.description:
Respond to party join request.

Only available for the logged in user (viewer).

Viewer must have a join request for party.

fields.name: sendPartyJoinRequest
fields.description:
Send party join request to specific party.

Only available for the logged in user (viewer).

fields.name: updatePlayerCrossPlayPreference
fields.description:
Update standard preferences for a player.

Only available for the logged in user (viewer).

Setting crossPlayEnabled to null will reset to the default value.

fields.name: user
fields.description:
User collecting the challenge.

Usually the viewer, but it could be any user in the future.

fields.name: game
fields.description: (Deprecated) Game which the challenge is part of.

fields.name: gameEdge
fields.description: Game of the challenge being collected and the user's metadata for that game.

fields.name: periodicChallenge
fields.description: (Deprecated) Challenge that is being collected

fields.name: periodicChallengeEdge
fields.description: Periodic challenge being collected and the user's metadata.

fields.name: alreadyCollected
fields.description:
Instead of throwing an error, we treat this case as data. Then the mutation
succeeds and we can still return the payload data.

fields.name: user
fields.description:
User redeeming the reward.

Usually the viewer, but it could be any user in the future.

fields.name: game
fields.description: (Deprecated) Game which the reward is part of.

fields.name: gameEdge
fields.description: Game of the reward being redeemed and the user's metadata for that game.

fields.name: reward
fields.description: (Deprecated)  Reward that is being redeemed.

fields.name: rewardEdge
fields.description: Reward being redeemed and the user's metadata.

fields.name: alreadyRedeemed
fields.description:
Instead of throwing an error, we treat this case as data. Then the mutation
succeeds and we can still return the payload data.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

args.name: limit
args.description: Number of occurrences allowed over duration.

args.name: duration
args.description: Number of seconds before limit is reset.

args.name: limit
args.description: Number of occurrences allowed over duration.

args.name: duration
args.description: Number of seconds before limit is reset.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
